statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: CS Northridge 117, Hope International 55
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Mike Efevberha scored 33 points in just 28 minutes to lead five players in double figures in Cal State Northridge's 117-55 non-conference victory Thursday against Hope, an NAIA school. The point total ranks tied for third all-time in Cal State Northridge history and is the most scored since the Matadors posted 117 points in December 2002 against Bethany, another NAIA school. The Matadors annually play one NAIA team early each season and has won the last eight by an average of 43 points. Efevberha added three steals and five assists. The junior guard is averaging 26 points a game for Northridge (4-1) and entering Thursday's game was ranked 13th nationally in scoring. For the Matadors, Jonathan Heard also scored 17 points, Terrell Jones added 16 points, Keith Everage scored 13 points, and Austin Waggener added 11 points with 11 rebounds. The Matadors shot 56 percent from the floor and forced 16-of-28 turnovers by steals. Carlos Villareal led Hope (0-5) with 15 points, and 5-foot-7 Joey Kinnard added 13 points.
